I have been around EverQuest a long, long time. I have seen what goes on behind the scenes as a Guide, I know many a GM, and a few programmers...I have seen through their eyes as well. I am not saying I am an "EverQuest Expert" by any means, but I DO know the game of EverQuest. I know the difference between rumors and truths, among other things. But before any of this I was a player...just like you, and I still am a player - just like you. Over time I have watched how "The Powers That Be" viewed the importance of players slowly fade away...but I have not, hence the birth of EQ Crossfire. This place is for you, a place to vent your frustrations, voice your concerns and praises, or debate and discuss certain aspects of this marvelous game. I will post voting sections, guest editorials, my personal views on some of the aspects of EverQuest, and answer questions and dispell rumors, honestly, with the information I have available to me and what I have learned over time. If I do not know, then I will work to find the answer. Over all, this is your podium, your soap box. I do this to help preserve the role play aspects and pure mechanics of this game - to help this game evolve into what we all know it is capable of. I hope you would do the same, not just for yourself, but for other players, like yourself, everywhere.
July 21st

Well gang, it has been a long time...I was checking on the site (as I do about once a week) and I noticed some Message Board traffic. Thanks to that traffic is why you are reading this now. I was close to calling it quits, putting EQ behind me and getting on with my life, but it seems there are some of you out there who are still in the "mix". Most excellent. Yeah I know - the links need to be updated as well as many other things, but I really don't want anything to do with EQ anymore. Now I look back and laugh when I think about how fanatical I was about EQ. Kinda scary. Now I have been doing a lot of CounterStrike, and playing the hell out of Icewind Dale and Diablo II (My 32nd level paladin is a force to be reckoned with, heh). In any case, I will be keeping Crossfire up for the time being, and who's to say - I just may come about and revamp the place for all you "old hats".

By the way, any e-mail can be sent to johnnycosmic@earthlink.net.

Check out EQ Joe's posts in the Message Boards, interesting. Also my helm goes off to "Uncle Van". Van if you are reading this - I have gotten some very good e-mails concerning you. I hear you play a bit on Bristlebane - if that is so, maybe you will remember a 45th level paladin by the name of Zarrinn, he is I and I am him (or used to be). In any case, good to see some good ole decent folk still around Norrath.

Azorath (EQCrossfire Admin)
The "bread and butter" of EQ Crossfire! Go ahead...jump in the fire!
This is just what the title says! If you have ever been continually harassed, unfairly dueled, or cheated and wish to warn others - this is where you do it. Also listed here are hackers, habitual exploiters, notorious campers, vulgar idiots, kill stealers, and fraudulent merchants, as well as many other juvenile delinquents...generally these are people that should not be playing EverQuest, and because they are, they are ruining it for not only you, but many other players as well.
Another self-explanatory title! This is for all the kind and gracious souls. Either it be a stranger's healing spell or SOW, a fair and honest merchant, or a higher level character awarding newbies with items and/or assistance. They can be your friends, you family, or in most cases a complete stranger. This is where you honor their sacrifice. These people are those that make playing EverQuest a joy, not only to you but other players as well.
From Character Classes to Verant Customer Service...what do you think?
